attributes.action: Lower the NHS charges at dentists
attributes.background: The NHS charges at dentists are becoming more akin to private treatment and beyond the budget of ordinary people. The result is that people suffer poor dental health because they can't afford the cost.
attributes.additional_details: The average cost of seeing a Dental Hygienist is now £59. A 6 monthly check up is over £30 and if work needs doing, it can be hundreds of pounds.

attributes.action: Reform schools’ complaints system
attributes.background: The Department for Education refuse to investigate complaints from innocent students who suffer school bullying or targeting by school staff/other authorities by not obtaining all the relevant records needed for a fair investigation. We need a new body to investigate failures over the last 25 years.
attributes.additional_details: Reform the system as bullying ruins the lives of victims regardless of age or disability this new body should have all the powers necessary to investigate complaints from students/parents against schools & local authorities where children have been forced out of school, expelled, parents labelled & false reports made. Sadly, it is a daily occurrence for some schoolchildren and is sometimes so severe that victims lose out on schooling, self-harm or even take their own life. This cannot be right.

attributes.action: Ban the use of full names in GP or hospital waiting rooms
attributes.background: Confidentiality is up most important in settings such as GP surgeries and hospitals. Data protection laws are tougher now than ever. However they don’t seem to apply when in a waiting room, the professional will call you through by using your full name in front of other people.
attributes.additional_details: I am starting this petition after a prisoner attached to their guard in a waiting room was called through for his appointment. All it took was for me to google their name and gather information as to why they were in prison, how long their sentence was and their address. People’s identities should be protected in GP and hospital waiting rooms.

attributes.action: Tax on meat and dairy products to offset the damage caused in their production.
attributes.background: According to a news article published in late 2017 the global livestock industry causes 15% of all global greenhouse emissions, furthermore the over consumption of meat in the UK seriously damages health and is associated with hugely elevated heath care costs.
attributes.additional_details:
Excessive meat and dairy production damage both health and the environment. We call upon the government to tax their consumption along the lines of tobacco, alcohol and the burning of fossil fuels.

Research from the University of Oxford suggests surcharges of 40% on meat and 20% on milk would account for the damage their production causes, and reduce the impact of both emissions and unhealthy consumption. We ask the government to discuss the adoption of a tax at these levels.

attributes.action: Stop playing Vivaldi as hold music on the benefit enquiries line.
attributes.background: Whilst it is understandable that businesses do need waiting music to occupy the minds of enquirers, playing Vivaldi's 'Spring' over and over again creates associations incompatible with the normal levels of appreciation that one should have for such a classical musician.
attributes.additional_details: Several benefit numbers spout the same song over and over again. After 15 minutes one becomes irked. After 20 minutes, the music has slightly disturbing undertones and after 30 minutes the listener turns exasperated, frantic and starts to shout at their handset. This is not ideal: it breeds frustration and resentment at Vivaldi, the benefits line and possibly the government as a whole.

attributes.action: Dual the entire route of the A47
attributes.background: Tens of thousands of vehicles use the A47 every year. It is one of the most important roads in the UK more specifically the East of England. The route is also used by numerous logistics companies. However there are also hundreds of accidents every   causing confusion and delay.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all Police Officers to carry Taser by 2020
attributes.background: Make it compulsory for all Police Officers to carry a Taser gun by 2020 to protect Police Officers and the public.

attributes.action: Make a mandatory minimum sentence for child sex offenders
attributes.background:
To many sex offenders get let of with community punishment orders ect I think there should be more of a deterrent and a mandatory minimum prison sentence. 
Also the public especially those with children should have acces to view if any registered sex offenders live in the area they reside.

attributes.action: Re-instate legal aid in all childrens' cases
attributes.background: Currently the law with regards to legal aid and childrens cases only comes into effect if the case is in a public interest, private cases are not covered under legal aid and because of this those who can not afford a solicitor are being forced to prove they are exempt from paying court costs.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is to request that legal aid is made available on all cases regarding child law so that no person fighting for custody or access under private law is penalized or forced into debt by having to fund court cases over their child, every parent has a right and legal aid should be available for all not just the privileged few that are able to represent themselves. Without this those on benefits are unable to have assistance from solicitors to help with their case

attributes.action: UK to cut ties and impose sanctions on Pakistan until they rerun elections
attributes.background: It has been reported that the recent Pakistani elections were one of the dirtiest and most rigged elections in many years. The media reports that Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz was the main target of election irregularities and rigging across the country.
attributes.additional_details: According to the media, Pakistan Army soldiers were present inside every polling station at the end of the polling before the polling count started they intervened and forced every polling agent to leave the polling premises. Political parties in Pakistan have rejected these rigged polls. Pakistan's Election Commission should conduct free and fair elections.

attributes.action: Require companies to tell applicants the status of their job application.
attributes.background: Applicants should have a right to receive a reply from employers. This petition isn’t to push for critical feedback, but a simple “yes, you have a job” or “no, you haven’t." Failure to reply within a reasonable time-frame should be punished by fines, depending on the company's size.
attributes.additional_details:
A simple reply from an employer can help better a person's options. People seeking work explore and apply for various types of employment, unskilled jobs, career and training programs or apprenticeships; and often, many of these jobs would start around the same time. Some options may be better than others depending on the individual, and a simple reply of “yes”, “no” or “still being reviewed” can improve a person on making a better choice financially or for their lifestyle.

Placing an applicant in a state of suspense and stress, sometimes for months when it comes to programs and apprenticeships is a cruel situation to place anyone in, when a feedback about the application will allow an applicant to move on and accept other options.

attributes.action: Give full time members of the armed forces a council tax exemptions
attributes.background: Service personnel who live in a property that is not on a base have to pay council tax, however many of these due to where they are based actually live in these addresses minimally. they have to pay SILCOT the armed forces equivalent of council tax, as such they effectively pay double council tax

attributes.action: Make it a requirement for supermarket delivery vehicles to be fully electric.
attributes.background: Make it a legal requirement for the big six supermarket retailers in the UK (Tesco's, Sainsbury's, Adsa, Morrisons, Waitrose and Iceland.) to have a fleet of fully electric delivery vehicles by April 2019.
attributes.additional_details: As supermarket delivery vehicles only deliver/operate in city they are based in and surrounding towns & villages they rarely have to travel long distances which means that they would never be too far away from a charging point and when the vehicles are not being used (overnight ect) they can be charged at the supermarket ready for their next job. The electrification of delivery vehicles would help lower pollution levels and help save the earth.

attributes.action: Stop the state pension reducing tax allowances for working pensioners
attributes.background: Many people remain in work beyond retirement age training the next generation. Some work because they need to top up their income rather than turn to the state for benefits. Decreasing tax codes re-taxes PAYBACK of money already paid in tax. This was not an investment but saving.
attributes.additional_details: What the government should do is change the law so the state pension doesn't count towards someone's personal tax allowance if they are working. Having completed one working career paying for that pension, the government should allow people to continue to work without having their tax code reduced. This double tax on pensions puts people off continuing to contribute to society. The well being of remaining part time in work reduces a burden on the state. State pension is a PAYBACK and not an additional income!

attributes.action: A cycle path should be provided by law when roads are  redeveloped or created
attributes.background: housing estates on east way in Preston lancashire have been built and accompanying pavements but no cyclepaths have been created.

attributes.action: Change ‘national speed limit’ signs so they show the actual speed for that road
attributes.background: The current National speed limit signs are confusing for most drivers on our roads. If the signs were to display an actual speed limit for any given road this would take away any uncertainty.

attributes.action: Request intervention in Myanmar at the Security Council against genocide
attributes.background: soldiers in Myanmar have committed genocide according to the United Nations . Amnesty International has also found evidence including forensic medical evidence, corroborated witness testimony and satellite imagery of crimes against humanity.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/uk.mobile.reuters.com/article/amp/idUKKCN1GJ167
https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2018/06/atrocities-against-the-rohingya-how-we-built-the-case-to-implicate-myanmar-military-officials-in-crimes-against-humanity/

attributes.action: Explain how Juvenile Covert Human Intelligence Sources are used & kept safe.
attributes.background:
It was recently reported that the government use what they describe as Juvenile Covert Human Intelligence Sources (otherwise known as children) are used in intelligence services. 

If a government is willing to put children at risk the public deserve to know why, when and how they are kept safe.

attributes.action: Hot weather payment to stay cool
attributes.background: Emergency payment for those in need to keep cool in such extreme heat
attributes.additional_details: Cold weather payments are made so people don't die of cold but a person can die of heat stroke just as much

attributes.action: To review current criminal law relating to rape and sexual offences.
attributes.background:
I would like the government to review current law and to implement a 3-point plan.

Educate - To make sexual education compulsory in all Secondary schools.
Prevent - Increased awareness around high-risk areas (nightclubs, pubs etc).
Prosecute - Increase current minimum term guideline for crimes.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe more can be done to reduce crime relating to rape and sexual offences. I am constantly heartbroken, daily, to read about it on the news. The crime is unforgivable and I think we have a duty as a society to call for more action which will protect the general public. 

- Approximately 85,000 women and 12,000 men are raped in England and Wales alone every year.
- Rape Crisis specialist services were accessed by 78,461 individuals an increase of 17% from 2016-17.

attributes.action: Free Sanitary products for women and girls on benefits
attributes.background: Read a homeless lady on Tube crying and asking fellow passengers if any had spare Tampons or Pads ; if chaps had to use them bet they would be FOC

attributes.action: Registration with the charities commission be mandatory for religious bodies.
attributes.background: We need to ensure all religious organisations collecting money are registered with the charities commission. Therefore they must publish their accounts and be willing to have them independently audited for fraud and questionable use of money.

attributes.action: Ban smoking within 6 meters from public entrances; exempting pubs and clubs.
attributes.background: As an extension to the Health Act of 2006, extending the ban around public entrances further benefits non-smokers, while not providing additional hardships on smokers.  This benefits ground level offices mostly as smokers usually do so just outside, causing smoke to drift into nearby windows.
attributes.additional_details: In the strictest sense, no law regarding entrance proximity contravenes the Health Act as these environments are no longer smoke free.  While one cannot control wind direction and the like, distance away from these entrances would normally include distance from windows, as well as provide a better environment for visitors.  This ensures the well being and comfort of non-smokers indoors remains intact, and only requires smokers to travel a few additional steps.

attributes.action: Re-introduce free milk in primary and secondary schools
attributes.background: Free milk was a great way of making children that little bit happier about going to school, so now I believe we should reintroduce it back to schools

attributes.action: Stop the ban of menthol cigarettes when the UK leaves the EU
attributes.background: A cigarette is a cigarette menthol or not, it's just a preference as is coke with vodka. In 2020 menthol cigarettes were to be banned under new EU laws but the UK is preparing to leave the EU.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst on the topic binge drinking seems to be a regular thing and alcohol also takes/ruins many lives but I don't see any graphic images or warnings on alcohol. End the menthol and flavoured tobacco ban in 2020 since the UK is leaving the EU.

attributes.action: Limit new drivers 1100cc- first 12 mths, 14000cc-12-24 mths, 1600cc-24-36 mths
attributes.background: The cost of insurance is too high and the volume of accidents involving young drivers is also too high, bringing this in would hopefully reduce both

attributes.action: Require local councils to issue parking charges by recorded delivery
attributes.background: Sending PCNs by 2nd class postage does not guarantee delivery to home addresses and as a result quite often representation or appeal of the contravention is missed. Recorded delivery would eliminate this issue and the cost should be added to the original PCN meaning no cost to the council.
attributes.additional_details: There are many instances on multiple forums of people experiencing this exact issue. It’s unfair to not have received the original letter on time and as a result the fine being multiplied and even in some cases warrants issued to bailiffs. I personally didn't receive the first PCN letter and the fine was £65, now the fine is £195 as a result of not receiving the 2nd class letter sent out by the local council. Is this fair or just a money making loop hole by the councils.

attributes.action: Make the history of British colonialism part of high school curriculum.
attributes.background: Too many people, especially the new generation do not know anything about the British empire or the colonies which helped make Britain great. Some people are also oblivious to the pain and suffering the Empire caused as well as all the positive impacts it had to less affluent countries.
attributes.additional_details: Britain is a huge multicultural society. Our society, whatever their background need to be taught where they came from and how they got to the positions they are in now. It’s a too wider misconception that there has just been constant mass migrations for no apparent reason. I believe if the history of the British Empire were taught then a lot of what is happening in the present would be sympathised with and more could be done to resolve issues by all ethnicities.

attributes.action: Alter "laws" that bar certain Brits from jobs with the Secret Service.
attributes.background: The Home Office, FCO, MI5,MI6,HMGCC & other Gov’ Offices reject applicants simply because they don’t have a British Parent with British ties; even if they have a Naturalization Certificate and a British Passport. That these documents do “NOT” make one British enough to be appointed is unacceptable!
attributes.additional_details: Evidence is the Criterium openly set out as advertised on the Foreign Offices’ websites and MI5, MI6, also enshrined in UK Law.

attributes.action: Full Public Investigation into all Unresolved Complaints of NHS Medical Errors
attributes.background: For over 40 yrs, the system has failed to protect patients who have suffered medical accidents/errors under the NHS. A toxic culture has prevailed within the NHS of closing ranks to cover up complaints. We need a new body to investigate all unresolved complaints and the misuse of powers/public money
attributes.additional_details: Given the gravity of scale of covering up by the NHS & lack of action taken by complaint bodies & those in Government, this new body should have all the powers necessary to investigate all complaints. In order to avoid harm to patients the government need to carry out an investigation across the UK to identify the systemic failure across the NHS & avoid future harm to patients. It must include victims left with ongoing health problems/disabilities & families who have lost a loved one since 1980

attributes.action: Introduce retail transaction tax and abolish retailers’ business rates
attributes.background: Internet based companies have an unfair competitive advantage over traditional bricks and mortar retailers who have to pay business rates.  This disproportionate cost is contributing towards the demise and failure of the local high street.   Help redress the imbalance for all retailers.
attributes.additional_details:
A 0.5% retail business rate tax on each sales transaction value rather than property space would be a fairer arrangement and would be directly linked to the business’s success rather than the cause of its failure. 
Since most sales transactions for online and high street retailers are by credit card, the collection mechanism is already in place. The credit card holder’s physical location (in-store) or credit card address (online) are readily available for re-allocation to the local authorities.

attributes.action: Reform the police complaints system
attributes.background: For over 50 years, the system has failed to protect Black/Asian people from feeling targeted and racially profiled by the police. We need a new body to investigate police misuse of powers, recommend that individual officers be prosecuted or sacked and recommend ways to reform the police.
attributes.additional_details:
This new body should have all the powers necessary to investigate complaints itself, including being able to call witnesses and summon documents and records. Most importantly, it must include representatives of victims of police misconduct to ensure it has the confidence of every individual in society. People should be protected regardless of colour or background.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/207561
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/166709

attributes.action: Allow all shops (regardless of size) to open for only 6 hours on a Sunday.
attributes.background: The government should allow all shops (regardless of size) to open only for up to any 6 consecutive hours on a Sunday, because Sunday is a special day for families to get together. To protect the high street, the government should also ban home deliveries for online shopping on a Sunday.
attributes.additional_details: The government should allow all shops (regardless of size) to open only for any 6 hours on Sundays and the government should force all shops (regardless of size) to close on Easter Sunday and on Christmas Day when it falls on a Sunday. The only exceptions should be petrol stations that only sell fuel, airport shops (past security), pharmacies and shops on seagoing ships.

attributes.action: Stop private parking companies from imposing fines after you leave the premises.
attributes.background: Parliament should legislate to stop Private Parking Companies from imposing penalty charges after a vehicle has left the location where enforcement is in place.
attributes.additional_details:
Private parking companies should only be able to impose a charge on the spot or must install barriers at entry and exit points to accept payment.
 
Issuing notices by post should be prohibited. 
 
It is a simple solution to a very controversial industry.

attributes.action: Introduce a (5%) Voluntary Tax where people can allocate as they choose
attributes.background: There is a lot of shouting about the lack of funds here and there. NHS, education, police and soforth. But no-one especially wants a tax raise, especially when their funds are tight. What this idea is a voluntary tax, but one where a person can specifically choose where that tax goes.
attributes.additional_details:
The way it would work it would be something that people can opt-in, or opt-out. Opt-in of a voluntary tax, and they would then pick a choice where they want that payment of tax to be allocated. For example.
>NHS >Education >Roads >Railways >Military etc.

attributes.action: Condemn killings by the Indian government
attributes.background: On 23rd May 2018, Indian and local Tamil Nadu government forces killed 13 unarmed civilians protesting against environmental disaster created by Sterlite copper in Tuticorin, TN owned by Vedanta resources plc.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government must condemn this human rights violation and urge the India Government to protect human rights, including people’s right to protest.

attributes.action: Allow the purchase of alcohol between 8am and 11pm
attributes.background: The purchase of alcohol should be allowed between 8am and 11pm as the times the law describe are just too late. I have personal relations with close friends who are heavily reliant on alcohol and need it for medicinal reasons but have to endure a long mornings and nights in pain.
attributes.additional_details: It is understood the reasons for the times that are set but i honestly feel the reasons behind this law have now become mostly irrelevant. It is unfair on these people who have to suffer most mornings and nights because of this. It is hard seeing close ones in these situations.

attributes.action: Allow Left turns on red like in the USA
attributes.background: So in the USA you can legally turn Right on a red light which helps with easing traffic and lowering co2 emmisons So I think that when applicable We should be allowed to turn left on red due to us driving on the left side of the road. This would greatly decrease co2 emmisons and traffic in cities.

attributes.action: Establish an Atrocities Prevention Board.
attributes.background: Human rights and the prevention of mass atrocities should be at the centre of our foreign policy thinking. An Atrocities Prevention Board, made up of representatives from across government, would ensure a comprehensive approach to identify and address threats to vulnerable groups of people.
attributes.additional_details:
Barack Obama established an Atrocities Prevention Board (ABP) in 2012. It has improved the US government's ability to identify early threats and widened the tools with which those threats can be dealt with. It has also provided the impetus to take early action in a number of countries that might otherwise not have received such attention.

A UK equivalent could spur on a similar change and ensure that genocide and mass atrocity prevention are a priority at the highest levels of government.

attributes.action: Lower the cost of taking the Practical driving test.
attributes.background: Every year roughly 850,000 driving tests are conducted but only 47-50% pass. That means one in two tests taken leads to a fail. Although the tests are getting harder, the price of it still remains incredibly high at £62.00. Driving should be a fun and educational life skill not a burden.
attributes.additional_details:
1. Roughly 850,000 driving tests are taken every year in the UK.
2. Only 47-50% pass the test.
3. Tests are getting harder but price is still sky high at £62.00.
4. If you are using your instructors vehicle the cost may increase even more.

attributes.action: Institute a Personage & Citizenry Act
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, call on parliament to institute a new act that grants automatic citizenship to any persons that can demonstrate that they have lived continuously in this country for 15 or more years. Subject to having not committed a serious criminal offence
attributes.additional_details:
This act would help secure the rights of people affected by the windrush scandal as well as those people who have migrated here that may be subject to the same treatment in the future.

Personage should be granted to those who are working here to act as a temporary status of citizenry for 5 years. If they continue to hold employment for that time then at the end of the 5 years they are granted full citizenry.

attributes.action: Investigate the role of the Information Commission due to its ineffectiveness
attributes.background: Call for an investigation into the role of the ICO and why they refer the public back to, and do not act against, the public bodies/organisations who do not reply to data requests and maintain their silence in order to block/obstruct complaints. Urgent changes/reforms to the law need to be made
attributes.additional_details: Due to the advice by the petitions committee when rejecting 3 petitions - https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/206379 - https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/205268 - https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/213769 we call on the government/Secretary of State to make appropriate provision to ensure that the Information Commission act to assist members of the public to obtain full disclosure of their records in order to pursue complaints further & ban public bodies from withholding records

attributes.action: Vehicle tax to include levy for repair of roads maintained by local authorities
attributes.background: The condition of local roads is poor.  Pot holes and bad repairs are a mounting problem that impact all road users.  The situation in places can be dangerous and cause significant costs.  A link to vehicle tax would be a link to the number of vehicles and thus provide proportionate funds.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence can be found in the budget of local authorities.  Requirements exceed funding, over many years, by large amounts.

attributes.action: Fund “Off The Street, Less Heat” youth project and similar projects
attributes.background: Off the Street, Less Heat is a youth diversion project which provides sports and other workshops to distract young people from anti-social behaviour, gang-related violence and street crime. Due to Government cuts, it and projects like it have lost funding.
attributes.additional_details: Off the Street, Less Heat was started in 2006/07 by Elaine Roberts, who came up with the name and idea, to help get young people off the streets and welcome people from all different communities. The project also aims to improve the relations between the police and the local community. Off the Street, Less Heat and similar projects all over the country need direct funding from the Government to ensure that they can continue.

attributes.action: Set out a date for the introduction of care home fees cap.
attributes.background: The Government has been making false promises to put a limit on care home fees since 2011. Last election, the Government promised in its lying manifesto to introduce a cap.
attributes.additional_details: People like me and my family that have worked hard bought our own homes and have been  "prudent with our money," have not been "rewarded" as the Government promised.

attributes.action: Stop Public Health England's recent 'Healthy Eating' initiatives.
attributes.background: PHE have launched several initiatives to make people more 'calorie-aware'. This includes Change4Life's 'look for 100-calorie snacks, two a day max' and the One You Campaign, which advises adults to follow a 400-600-600 diet. Calorie Counting leads to a fixation on numbers and disordered eating.
attributes.additional_details: Anorexia has the highest mortality rate of any psychiatric disorder, with at least 20% of Anorexia sufferers dying prematurely. (Source: BEAT Eating Disorders). Full recovery from this illness involves moving away from all preoccupation with food. Therefore, calorie counting is incompatible with recovery and may lead to a rise in eating disorders. Please support me to ensure more people are protected from this life-ruining condition.

attributes.action: Urge the international community to bring Bashar al Assad to justice.
attributes.background:
Since the start of the Syrian Civil War in 2011, hundreds of thousands of civilians have been murdered in Syria, with the vast majority of deaths being attributed to Assad and his forces.

The international community must do more to bring Assad to justice.
attributes.additional_details:
Assad has invalidated his sovereignty over Syria. Hundreds of thousands of his own people have been murdered and tortured. Intervention is justified and necessary both morally and politically on the basis of these grave human rights violations. 

http://sn4hr.org

http://www.syriahr.com/en/

attributes.action: Inquiry on collapse of Monarch & the safeguarding of pensions
attributes.background: There have been calls for a public inquiry to the collapse of Monarch airlines and maybe look into changing the law on pensions so when a company goes into administration money can be put aside for the pension fund.
attributes.additional_details: The Chair of Parliament’s Work and Pensions Committee expressed concern over claims that private equity group Greybull Capital could avoid losing money while the carrier’s pension fund – which is owed £7.5m – could be among creditors left with nothing.

attributes.action: End Equal Opportunities Question about your race when applying for jobs
attributes.background: When applying for a job vacancies in the UK the employer always state that they are an equal opportunity employer and  you are required to state your ethnic minority group. Now this give the employer the opertunity discriminate against prospective employees the election  process.
attributes.additional_details: People from ethnic minority groups are being discriminate against whilst applying for job vacancy online In the pre selection process by employer. The question about stating what ethnic minority group you are from should be omitted from online application forms all together. If you are applying for a job that you are qualified for the question about your race shouldn't be of importance to the employer for selection. I applied for the same job with the same details but change my race from one to next and recieve a call the following day.

attributes.action: Work with airlines and other countries to make all planes have disabled toilets
attributes.background: Why should disabled people only have short haul holidays and not drink on the flight? Surely this is discrimination. The UK Government must work with other countries to make airlines commit to making all planes accessible to disabled people.
